results.definition: the side that is forward or prominent
a person used as a cover for some questionable activity
a group of people with a common ideology who try together to achieve certain general goals
examples: he led the national liberation front

results.definition: be oriented in a certain direction, often with respect to another reference point; be opposite to
the immediate proximity of someone or something
examples: he was well behaved in front of company

results.definition: the line along which opposing armies face each other
a sphere of activity involving effort
examples: the Japanese were active last week on the diplomatic front
they advertise on many different fronts

results.definition: (meteorology) the atmospheric phenomenon created at the boundary between two different air masses
relating to or located in the front
the outward appearance of a person
examples: he put up a bold front

results.definition: the part of something that is nearest to the normal viewer
examples: he walked to the front of the stage

results.definition: the side that is seen or that goes first
